english.segment1: the camel in the desert took a ship across the lake. while the fish in search of water found a fig with a bellyache. who overheard the waves as they headed for the shore. "we're not so sure of separations anymore."
english.segment2: at the caterpillar picnic, brother butterfly stole. a rhubarb stem, licked and dipped it in the sugar bowl
english.segment3: caught up for Massachusetts in a double-stacked train. through the adirondacks spinning like a weathervane. gathering and cutting and splitting and stacking the wood. our fuel is neatly piled and we all feel good
english.segment4: we pretend to care and like we understand, our eyes go soft but know it now -. what we're thinking about is your mammary glands and how to sail your birth canal. we found the pot that fit the lid no less now then when we were smarter did. our thoughts are like a tea bag on the saucer, all the flavor gone
english.segment5: that dog below our waist aroused, when arms embraced the pretty gals. it came much more as a surprise, it happening when i hugged the guys. we planted for the final frost, we once were found and now we're lost. we got a heck of a lot to learn about remaining taciturn.
